Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; alternating added red and added white rays above two white bands; below, lotus buds in white outline with red centres above two white bands; exterior: streaky brown band; graffito stroke on exterior.
Curator's comments: The exterior decoration is typical of the decoration on the lower part of Mature Animal Style chalices. The interior decoration, which is elaborate, is also a typical feature of Mature Animal Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0454) (phase 2)
